text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.
SOYBEAN SALE - An Owensboro Grain Co official said the company on Wednesday bought about 150,000 tonnes of optional-origin soybeans for May, June and July shipment.

- A trader at Glencore in Brazil said a 45,000 tonne sale of soybeans to a U.S. firm which he earlier confirmed had fallen through and did not actually occur. The trader on Wednesday confirmed market talk that Glencore had sold 45,000 tonnes of Brazilian soybeans to a U.S. firm, which contributed to a tumble in soybean futures prices in Chicago.

CORN AND WHEAT SALE - The CCC purchased 16,080 tonnes of yellow corn and 15,180 tonnes of hard red winter wheat for export to Angola. The grain was purchased from Continental Grain, with the wheat priced at $176.89 and corn at $129.39 a tonne, both FOB Beaumont. Delivery is slated for April 1-25.

WHEAT AND BARLEY SALE - The Japanese Food Agency said Thursday it bought 120,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat, 20,000 tonnes of Canadian wheat, 20,000 tonnes of Australian wheat, 20,000 tonnes of Canadian barley and 40,000 tonnes of Australian barley at its weekly tender. All purchases were for May shipment.

WHEAT SALE - Sri Lanka on Wednesday night bought a total of 100,000 tonnes of wheat, 50,000 tonnes of which was Argentine hard wheat and 50,000 tonnes of European Union soft wheat, several U.S. exporters said. One U.S. exporter said the wheat was slated for April delivery but another exporter said the shipment for the European wheat was set for March 31-April 9 and the Argentine hard wheat for April 21-30.
- Lebanon's economy ministry said Loreco, agent for international wheat firm MAPCO, won a bid to supply Beirut with 50,000 tonnes of U.S. hard wheat in two shipments of 25,000 tonnes each.

CORN SALE - South Korea's National Livestock Cooperatives Federation said it bought 75,000 tonnes of Chinese corn from Louis Dreyfus. It added it passed on tenders for the remaining 137,500 tonnes of corn and 105,000 tonnes of feed wheat due to high offer prices.
- Taiwan's Members Feed Industry Group bought 54,000 -tonnes of U.S. No.2 corn from Angre on Thursday.

CORN AND WHEAT TENDERS - South Korea's National Livestock Cooperatives Federation said it invited tenders for 212,500 tonnes of corn and 105,000 tonnes of wheat by 1:30 p.m. (0430 GMT). The corn tenders were split into 11 positions.

SOYMEAL TENDER - South Korea's National Livestock Cooperatives Federation said on Thursday it would invite tenders for 32,000-40,000 tonnes of soybean meal by 11:00 a.m. (0200 GMT) on Friday. An NLCF official said arrival was set by July 20 to South Korean ports of Inchon, Kunsan and Ulsan.
BARLEY TENDER - Iran will tender for the import of 50,000 tonnes of optional-origin feed barley on March 17, European grain traders said on Thursday. The barley is for shipment in May.

WHEAT TENDER - South Korea's Cheiljedang Corp and Dongah Flour Mills Co Ltd have jointly invited tenders to buy a total of 22,500 tonnes of U.S. No.1 wheat by 2:00 p.m. (0500 GMT) on Friday, traders said on Thursday.

- Tunisia on Wednesday launched a tender for the purchase of five lots of soft wheat of 25,000 tonnes each or more. Last deadline for submitting offers was set for Friday March 14 at 0930 GMT. Shipment dates for the five lots of wheat are - April 20-30, May 1-10, May 10-20, May 20-30 and June 1-10.
- News was awaited on Iraq's tender for 50,000 tonnes U.S. hard red winter wheat for May delivery, exporters said.
- The CCC is seeking up to 25,550 tonnes of wheat for donation to Jordan and Yemen for April 1-25 shipment.

CORN TENDER - The CCC said it would seek up to 4,620 tonnes of No. 2 or better yellow corn under its export program for Guatemala. Offers were due on March 19 and the shipment dates were slated for April 3-27.

RICE TENDER - Costa Rica will seek on March 19 a total of 30,000 tonnes optional origin rough rice which would likely be from the United States and/or Argentina, U.S. exporters and trade sources said. One U.S. exporter said he believed the paddy rice was slated for June arrival while another said it was set for May.

MARKET TALK - Russian organisations are interested in supplying Iraq with 100,000 tonnes of wheat, 50,000 tonnes of sugar and other foodstuffs, Interfax news agency quoted a ministry official as saying on Thursday.
... Indian rice exporters said the Philippines is considering buying about 200,000 tonnes of rice from India.

... Malaysia is looking to buy up to 50,000 tonnes of Chinese corn while an Indonesian trade house may also be shopping around for another 50,000 tonnes of corn from either China or Argentina, traders said.
((Doris Frankel 312-983-7305))
